creator: apache@elexer.com
text:
Problem:
Performance of Apache 2.0.46 on 2000 Advanced Server is very poor compared to 
IIS on a single file.

Steps to reproduce:
Use Windows 2000, Advanced Server and download a file from localhost. 
Performance is good.
Download a file using a networked machine, and performance gets stuck to about 
600kbyte/sec (10mbit network). IIS gets +/- 980kbyte/sec.

Platforms;
Windows 2000 Advanced Server.
GA, SP2 and SP3 all show the same problem.
QoS, difference in hardware, servicepack, are all excluded.
WindowsXP does not exhibit this behaviour.


Additional reports of this same problem:
See:
http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=apache-httpd-users&m=105403065124319&w=2
http://groups.google.com/groups?hl=nl&lr=&ie=UTF-8&threadm=uhb1uabsa1jt00%
40corp.supernews.com

I've put up an proposed fix for this on http://azrael.elexer.com/zooi/apache-
2046-win32.diff (i can't seem to attach files?)

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
As pointed out in the dev@httpd discussion thread, it stinks but we cannot
  sendfile and either;

  * come back after a network timeout, or
  * determine the (arbitrary) amount of data sent.

  It seems the WinSock API and TransmitFile are lacking for some means of
  neatly honoring socket timeout parameters in a faux-blocking mode.

  Suggestions and contributions welcome, provided they continue to honor the
  timeout to prevent the obvious resulting DoS if TransmitFile is not timed out.
